name: refound
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
discovered or obtained again: A party was organized, and harmony was refound. The new hospital fits the town's re-found prosperity.
More examplesFewer examplesThere has been a big recovery in corporate profits, but so far managements have found little they want to spend their refound wealth on.He wouldn't shift from his comfortable re-found routine of doing nothing at his parents' home.The teacher must have the ability to remain open to discovering new or refound musical experiences.

to bring something into existence again: The family returned to England, where they intended to refound their business.
More examplesFewer examplesMany monasteries were founded and refounded in Rome between the sixth and ninth centuries.He wrote to his friend about his plans for re-founding the old political party.
